tweet: Join me in congratulating Barbara Ehrhart, @FHPSWFL's longest serving female officer, on retiring after 36 years of protecting Manatee County! #ThinBlueLine #Sayfie https://bit.ly/2YhWgRt

Honored to be recognized by @HumaneSociety with my friend @RepHastingsFL for our work to end the slaughter of dogs & cats sold for their meat. Although the US has banned this trade, millions of these animals continue to be killed for human consumption each year across the world. pic.twitter.com/xYYh45qImF

It is critical that we know the long-term impacts of red-tide on human health. I’ve asked our local experts to provide us with the science and I’ll work on getting them the funding. #Sayfie https://bit.ly/2JLAtsD

Torturing innocent animals is abhorrent and should be punished to the fullest extent of the law! @RepTedDeutch and I continue the bipartisan fight for the #PACTAct to #ProtectOurPets. pic.twitter.com/NxQ5ah23Wu

JUST NOW: the U.S. House passed my bill, the RAWR Act, which allows the State Department to offer rewards for information leading to the arrest or conviction of wildlife traffickers around the globe. pic.twitter.com/NZl1aqNIT9

Mr. Cruz, it is all America that appreciates your heroism and sacrifice on that fateful day. Mr. Cruz also happens to be the father of my communications director, Anthony. God bless you Mr. Cruz and all the others who gave so much at Ground Zero. #NeverForget

Got a wonderful note yesterday from a true American hero— Antonio J Cruz, a former New York City police lieutenant who was at Ground Zero on 911. Mr Cruz appreciated House passage of the 9-11 victims bill.

Congratulations to the @HeraldTribune and @BradentonHerald for winning top awards from the Florida Society of News Editors! Community newspapers play an important role and our region is lucky to have two of the best in Florida.  #Sayfie

Great talking with actor and activist Richard Gere this afternoon on human rights concerns in Tibet. Many of you may remember him from films like Pretty Woman and An Officer and a Gentleman. Gere was in Washington to speak with the @house_democracy, a bipartisan group I co-chair. pic.twitter.com/TYuisdtJft

Sad and disturbing to hear that a Starbucks coffee shop in Arizona asked six police officers to leave after a customer said they didn’t feel safe with police nearby. Do you think the officers should have been asked to leave?
Wishing everyone a happy and safe July 4th holiday! Thank you to all who have served and are currently serving at home and abroad. God Bless America! pic.twitter.com/fwD5MaBgjO

It was my pleasure to see Out-of-Door Academy’s Mira Khazanchi and her family. Mira is the 2019 High School Congressional Art Competition winner for Florida’s 16th District. Congratulations! pic.twitter.com/eYd6ivyUrQ
